job.title: Machine Learning Engineer
job.industry: Nonprofit Organization Management,Financial Services,Hospital & Health Care
job.description: stronguJobSpecific ResponsibilitiesbrbrustrongMatthew K Nock the Director of the Nock Lab in the Department of Psychology at Harvard University is seeking to hire a Machine Learning Engineer MLE  Data Scientist DS with expertise in machine learning ML and the management and analysis of data The MLEDS will work on studies aimed at advancing the understanding prediction and treatment of suicidal thoughts and behaviors The data to be managed and analyzed are from smartphonebased surveys passive smartphonewearable monitors and social media platforms The MLE will clean transform and merge data and will run advanced data analysesbrbrstronguIn Addition To Designing And Developing ML Models The MLE WillbrbrustrongThe MLE will work with a dynamic multisite team on projects aimed at improving identification of and intervention on mental health problems eg suicide using rich data sources The successful applicant will have strong programming skills sufficient knowledge and technical expertise in ML to execute tasks independently advanced data management and analysis skills and interest in application of ML to the healthcare sectorbrulliWork with the research team to design develop and implement ML modelsliliCreate and assist in development of infrastructure for cleaning processing analyzing and visualization of various data types eg GPS data scraped from smartphones accelerometer data from wearable devices digital phenotyping data etcliliRun experiments to evaluate model performance perform error analysis and suggest and implement improvementsliliConduct higherlevel analysis of data and supervise analyses performed by other members of the labliliIntegrate data across workflows eg digital phenotyping behavioral and clinical dataliliPerform fiber tracking on DTI data specifying grouplevel models for DTI dataliliProgram behavioral tasks and archive studiesliliAssist with preparation of grant applications presentations and publicationsbrliulstrongTypical Core DutiesbrstrongulliCollaborate with researchers in the design planning and implementation software that enriches research productivity and reliabilityliliBuild understanding of research activities through regular engagementsliliProvide feedback on scope of work and project plan and track progress of regular milestonesliliBuild and maintain aspects of software code and custom data processing pipelines for complex environmentsliliApply firm understanding of specific technology to develop custom solutions to meet researchers needsliliWork in a team of developers and researchers in collaboration with systems professionalsliliProvide regular communications to project leads with updatesliliBuild internal code design and development guides for future contributorsliliTeach workshops for researchers on sustainable software and data management practicesliliAbide by and follow the Harvard University IT technical standards policies and Code of ConductbrliulstronguBasic QualificationsbrustrongulliMinimum of five years postsecondary education or relevant work experiencebrliulstronguAdditional Qualifications And SkillsbrustrongulliPhD or Masters Degree in Computer Science Data Science Electrical Engineering Mathematics Statistics Psychology or related fieldliliExpertise in one or more programming languages Python andor JavaScript preferredliliPrior applied experience designing and developing ML modelslili5 years of data management and analysis experienceliliExperience cleaning and analyzing digital phenotyping dataliliAdvanced statistical skills including expertise with longitudinal data analysis eg multilevel modeling and strategies for dealing with missing dataliliExperience with toolkits such as TensorFlow PyTorch or KerasliliDemonstrated history of commitment to open science and reproducible science eg via an active Github or OSF pageliliExpertlevel knowledge of statistical programming particularly R tidyverse ggplot2 and R MarkdownliliExperience with of survey software REDCap and QualtricsliliAbility to troubleshoot optimize and manage small and large projects with different timelinesliliAbility to work closely with people with a range of statistical programming knowledge from undergraduates to other expertsliliAbility to carefully consider conflicting demands of confidentiality of sensitive data and open scienceliliAbility to work independently with minimal supervision but also function well as part of a team have excellent formal and interpersonal communication skills and the ability to communicate technical information effectively to a broad range of audiencesliliLab experience andor coursework on selfinjury and suicidal behaviorsbrliulstrongWorking ConditionsbrstrongulliOccasionally required to work outside of normal business hours and may be contacted during off hoursliliHarvard will require COVID vaccination for all Harvard community members who will have any oncampus presence Individuals may claim exemption from the vaccine requirement for medical or religious reasons More information regarding the Universitys COVID vaccination
